validation_metadata.verification_method: Complete manual review MD Gen. Prov. § 4-101 et seq.

rights_of_access.description: Custodian must grant or deny request within 30 days of receipt. Mandatory deadline creates enforceable timeline.
rights_of_access.conditions: 30 days from receipt; must grant or deny; failure to respond triggers remedies
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: 30-day maximum - among longest state deadlines but still enforceable; silence after 30 days is improper
rights_of_access.request_tips: Track deadline: 'Md. Gen. Prov. § 4-203 requires response within 30 days. Please confirm expected response date.'

rights_of_access.description: If response will take more than 10 working days, custodian must notify requester within 10 days with anticipated timeline, estimated fees, and reason for delay.
rights_of_access.conditions: Required when response exceeds 10 days; must include timeline, fee estimate, and reason; notification within 10 working days
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Prevents surprise delays; requester gets advance notice of timeline and costs
rights_of_access.request_tips: If delayed: 'Md. Gen. Prov. § 4-203 requires 10-day notice if response takes longer, including timeline, costs, and reasons. Please provide this notification.'

rights_of_access.description: If denied, custodian must provide written statement within 10 working days with reasons for denial and notice of review remedies.
rights_of_access.conditions: Written statement required; within 10 working days; must explain reasons and remedies
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Creates documentation trail; informs requester of appeal rights; prevents vague denials
rights_of_access.request_tips: Demand written denial: 'Md. Gen. Prov. § 4-203 requires written denial within 10 days with specific reasons and notice of my review rights.'

rights_of_access.description: Public Access Ombudsman in Attorney General's Office mediates disputes between requesters and custodians. Free mediation service.
rights_of_access.conditions: Ombudsman cannot compel action; focuses on conflict resolution; accessible at (410) 576-6560
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Effective informal resolution mechanism; should consult before formal board complaint; often resolves issues quickly
rights_of_access.request_tips: Reference ombudsman: 'I may contact Maryland Public Access Ombudsman at (410) 576-6560 if this issue is not resolved.'

rights_of_access.description: PIA Compliance Board reviews formal complaints about wrongful denials, unreasonable fees over $350, failure to respond, or bad faith requests. Board can order compliance and assess penalties.
rights_of_access.conditions: Must consult ombudsman first; board handles formal complaints; can order remedies
rights_of_access.applies_to: PIA violations - denials, excessive fees, non-response
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Formal administrative enforcement; stronger than ombudsman; can issue binding orders
rights_of_access.request_tips: Escalate if needed: 'After ombudsman consultation, I may file formal complaint with PIA Compliance Board under Md. Gen. Prov. § 4-1A-01.'

rights_of_access.description: Custodian may charge reasonable fees for search, preparation, and reproduction. Fees must be reasonable and cost-based.
rights_of_access.conditions: Must be reasonable; based on actual costs; cannot be prohibitive
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Reasonableness requirement prevents excessive fees; agencies cannot use fees as barrier
rights_of_access.request_tips: Challenge excessive fees: 'Md. Gen. Prov. § 4-206 requires reasonable fees. Please provide itemized breakdown justifying these charges as reasonable.'

rights_of_access.description: Fees over $350 can be challenged as unreasonable before PIA Compliance Board. Creates accountability for expensive requests.
rights_of_access.conditions: Applies when fees exceed $350; requester can challenge reasonableness; board reviews and determines
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Protection against excessive fees; board reviews whether fees reasonable; provides recourse for expensive requests
rights_of_access.request_tips: Challenge high fees: 'Your fee estimate exceeds $350. Under Md. Gen. Prov. § 4-1A-02, I may seek PIA Compliance Board review of these fees as unreasonable.'

rights_of_access.description: Public records include documentary material in any form including computerized records. Electronic records have same status as paper.
rights_of_access.conditions: Format-neutral definition; includes all electronic/computerized records
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Broad definition covers databases, emails, electronic files; agencies cannot deny based on electronic format
rights_of_access.request_tips: For electronic records: 'Md. Gen. Prov. § 4-101 defines public records to include computerized records. Please provide access to [electronic files/database].'

rights_of_access.description: Attorney General publishes comprehensive PIA Manual providing guidance to agencies and requesters. Offers implementation guidance and interpretation.
rights_of_access.conditions: Manual publicly available; provides authoritative guidance; agencies should follow
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Detailed guidance available; agencies expected to follow AG manual recommendations; useful reference for requesters
rights_of_access.request_tips: Reference manual: 'Maryland AG PIA Manual provides guidance on this issue. Please follow AG recommendations for consistent statewide implementation.'

rights_of_access.description: Agencies must annually provide PIA contact information to ensure requesters know where to submit requests.
rights_of_access.conditions: Annual requirement; contact info must be publicly available
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Ensures accessibility; requesters can easily identify proper contact; reduces misdirected requests
rights_of_access.request_tips: Request contact: 'Please provide your designated PIA contact information as required by Maryland law.'
